newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australia managed futures fund market seen growing.
newsitem.headline: Australia managed futures fund market seen growing.

text.p: The market for managed futures funds in Australia has grown to A$400 million from nearly nothing two years ago as investors turn more to leveraged investment instruments, the Asia Pacific Managed Futures Association (APMFA) said on Thursday.

This compares with over US$30 billion under management in the United States, although the Australian market is poised for further growth because investors are seeking out potentially higher yielding investments, APMFA chairman Barry Brownjohn said.
"It has grown from only minimal levels two years ago," Brownjohn told Reuters.
Investors in Australia appear more at ease with leveraged instruments now than in the early 1990s, given the advent of leveraged shares and warrants and other instruments, he said.
Also, in a low inflation environment, investors are looking for new avenues to maximise opportunities, he said.
Brownjohn linked the growth to risk-adjusted returns, which are attractive to investors along the same lines as hedge fund investments.
APMFA plans to promote the Australian managed futures industry to investors domestically and aboard, he said.
"Interest rates are low, so the prospect of looking for alternative investments becomes more compelling," he said
A year after the Sydney Futures Exchange created a special class of membership for commodity trading advisers (CTAs), nearly a dozen have been admitted, he said.
